revised_title: Bright Lines in the Spectra of Stars and Nebulae: A Comparative Study
tldr: The author investigates the presence of bright lines in the spectra of stars and nebulae, agreeing with previous findings by Dr. Huggins and Mr. Stone. He suggests that the presence of a large coronal atmosphere in stars may result in visible bright lines alongside dark lines in their spectra, making it difficult to distinguish between stars and nebulae.
